												I used to play World of Warcraft for a few years, until I finally gave another MMO a try. This one seemed very promising and boy was I right. The game has such amazing visuals, at least for an MMO of this style, the story is well written, dungeons and partying up is extremely fun, and the fact that you do not have to make a million characters to play all the different classes, you can just make one character and master all the classes and jobs with that one character. It's an awesome game, I bought it about a week ago and already put 60 hours into the game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 7, 2015
I will update this review probably once I reach 1000+ hours. My hours are 160 at the time of this review.So you probably want a review from someone who doesn't play MMOs, or at least, didn't. I played Runescape back in 2007 with some friends. That was the only MMO I've ever played. FFXIV was still easy to learn, and I just didn't feel a stranger at all. It's impossible to not enjoy this game unless you just hate MMO's, or are impatient.I bought this like a month ago and I just reached level 50 dragoon. It's all so ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ amazing. The story is incredible, the music is stunning, the art is amazing, graphics are ridiculously beautiful. The classes (fighting classes, crafting classes, and gathering classes) are all uniquely rewarding. With that said, you can literally play as ANY class in the entire game with a single character. Wanna be a gladiator? Equip a sword. Miner? Equip a pickaxe. Wanna just ♥♥♥♥in cook? Equip a skillet. The community is wonderful. I'm no veteran hence my hours played, but I'm in a great Free Company (like a clan in other games) with great players that make me feel at home.However, this is definitely not a game for everyone. It could be quite intimidating to the average casual gamer who doesn't understand the basic principles of most MMO games. This game requires quite a bit of your time and patience. So, I would absolutely recommend looking up gameplay videos to understand the combat system if you're really questioning this purchase.I guess the only downside is I wasted my entire summer on a single video game. In the real life that sucks, but in Eorzea, it has been so wonderful.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 28, 2015
												I thought it was about time to write a review for this, since I've put quite some time into it.Final Fantasy 14 is really freaking amazing. There is always so much content for you to be doing.FF14 was my second paid MMO, first being a... RUNE game... Yeah you know the one. Anyway, this game just seems so much more superior than the other MMOs I have played. Both free and paid.When I first started playing this, I was clueless on so much. The game throws a lot at you in the beginning but it's also not difficult to catch on. I started in Ul'Dah, and for those who have played the game might know how easy it is for a newbie to get lost there in the beginning!The game has multiple classes you can play as. You can start as a Gladiator, Lancer, Arcanist... Anything available, really! And to make it better, once you reach level 10 (I think...), you are told that you can now change class whenever you wish. That's right, you read that correctly. So if you started as a Gladiator and then was having second thoughts, you can go ahead and change your class to whatever you want. Anything!There are also multiple crafting classes and gathering classes. Again, you can become these whenever you please. Crafters will make things like armours, weapons, foods and potions. And believe me, your gatherers and crafters are fantastic money makers.Now onto the content. Final Fantasy 14 is FLOOOOOODED with content. You really won't get bored. (Seriously, look at my time played ._.). The story is amazing, and I won't talk much about it to avoid spoilers. But IT'S GOOD. There is plenty of side quests for you to enjoy too. Some of them are quite funny, like the Hildibrand sidequest. Ontop of the quests, there are loads of dungeons, raids, primal fights and even PVP.You definately will not get bored playing this game. You'll always find yourself being able to do something. You might wanna go kill things to level up, run a dungeon, go and explore the world or sit down by a lake and do some fishing.The choice is yours, Adventurer ;)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 18, 2014
												Final Fantasy 14: ARR is probally one of the best P2P mmo's I've played in recent years, even moreso in my opinon than WoW etc.I've put a fair few hours into this game and played to max level at the time I left (lvl50). This game offers so much content and so many ways of playing that it is worth the £7 sub fee per month. Admitidly I did buy this game during a sale ( I picked it up for around £6) and it was worth every penny. However I can only base my review on my experience that I gained and of course you get what you want out of the game.Things I loved:-Each class levels up seperatly meaning that reaching max level with one class doesn't mean the end of the game.-Being able to switch class just by changing weapon/crafting item means seemless fluidity.-Being in a large Free Company (guild) is very enjoyable and many players are very friendly.-Even if you are not a huge Final Fantasy fan this is still a great MMO.-A nice loot greed/roll system that is done by class rather than all rolling on loot to stop people grabbing gear.-Daily quests/trails/challenges.-Fat chocobos.Things I didn't like so much:-Difficulty curve can be quite high and the ingame macro system isn't explained as well as it could be.-High level dungeon grinding for high level gear can be tedious especially as some gear can only be gained once per week.-All games have idiots and griefters on them, this is no exception.-£7 can be alot a month if you don't have alot of time to play.-Language barried can be a problem especially in dungeons.-People farming the later story missions skipping the cutscenes ruining it for first timers.Overall I can highly rate this game from a MMO point of view and while it does have it's downsides I put many happy hours into the game and met alot of nice people. Even if you are not a final fantasy fan, this game is a very nice MMO that is easy to pick up and enjoy!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 5, 2015
												I LOVE this game so far! Quitting WoW after 10 years and was looking for an MMO with depth. I've dabbled in Aion and Rift periodically, but thought I'd try FF 14. The negatives coming from World of Warcraft are the numerous loading screens and the steep learning curve. BUT!!! Honestly, the game is good enough that I don't mind much. The GCD is rather long initially, but combat speeds up as you receive more abilities. The ability to change classes on the fly is fantastic. This can be a drawback as it is easy to get sidetracked if you try to level everything at the same time. The graphics and attention to detail are stunning (especially if you like anime/Japanese-style art). FFXIV is heavily story-driven. Sadly, the cut-scenes aren't always voice acted, but many of them are interesting or entertaining for someone new to the franchise. I popped onto WoW to help my husband last night and it felt shallow and uninspired compared to FFXIV.If you are coming from Warcraft, bring your map/navigating skills. It took me a bit to get used to the maps/navigating compared to other MMOs. Also, do not skip the help topics...it will save you a LOT of trouble.

content:
Posted: March 3, 2016
												I strongly recommend this as an immersive, beautiful, extensively narrative-driven experience, to the point even the crafters and gatherers get their own storylines! While the combat is simplified, it's neither too simple nor too frustrating, and the native controller support is an absolute joy. More depth and complexity can be found in the crafting and gathering systems, although the game is still quite easy to understand.The world, while only consisting of a few maps, is gorgeous, memorable, and full of detail, both in characters and environment.The music is also fantastic, expressing a broad array of emotions, from the tender to the grand. The boss music as well is varied and intense and uses a variety of styles and instrumentation.Achievement hunters might find the game a bit of a grind, as some of the achievements are literally just grindwalls, especially the ones relating to the game's minigame hub, but the fact that most game systems have achievements attached to them, and the sheer array of activities that can be done, mean achievement-hunting is fairly involved and interesting from an intellectual point of view.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 12, 2015
												Honestly my favorite modern MMO. I've put countless hours into it and still find it endlessly enjoyable. The classes are all fun and unique, the crafting is active and interesting, and thanks to the job system you can experience everything the game has to offer with a single character.I took a break after finishing end game and getting all best in slot gear for my main class, but when I came back I found out that there was almost double the endgame content as when I left. This game is ever changing and ever expanding, new content is being added quite regularly, and it's not just new raids or dungeons. Whole new story quests, expanding on the lore, are added extremely often.I'm going to sum up my feelings in a list of good and bad from my perspective,******************************************************************************What's the good:The combat: It's slower then most other MMOs but that is a benefit, giving you more time to make a choice on what to do next and how it will be effective. It flows naturally and feels satisfying with just the right amount of power. Later in the game a boss fight stops being just a harder monster you need to work through, but instead becomes a kind of dance, each member of your party having their own role on the stage.The Quests: Yes, they are a lot of fetch quests and breadcrumbs, it's nothing special in the MMO world... But it somehow is. With all the dialog, lore, and the streamlined loot system, the quests in this game somehow transcend the "Go here and do this" standard. The first major thing you might notice? The quest givers know damned well what you're there for, the world has a long history of adventurers and questors, everyone knows you're there to help them with anything and damned if they are not going to take advantage of it. This makes for quite a fun experience as you do the most basic tasks for someone too lazy to pick up vegetables that are literally 5 feet away, and they acknowledge it. If you play and get to level 50, I HIGHLY recommend the "Hildibrand" Quest series started in Ul'dah, it will have you laughing till the end.The Dungeons: The dungeons in this game are basic, but awesome. Each able to be run in about 20-30 minutes and comprising of 3-4 bosses and trash. But they have a ton of atmosphere and charm, each one clearly was carefully crafted to be both visually appealing and challenging. And don't be fooled when you see the labels of "Hard mode" when you get to end game, Hard mode dungeons are not in fact just more difficult versions like in other MMOs, the game designers in fact go back and remake a dungeon from scratch, using the same location but a different path, with different trash and different bosses. Every Hard Mode is a whole new dungeon with a whole new story to it, causally taking place after the events you caused in the normal mode.Community: Other then a few bad eggs and elitists the community is extremely helpful and kind, you should never lack any help if you need it just by asking around. The game actually incentivizes high levels to help low levels with the Syncing system where a high level in specific situations can scale his/her level down to match a dungeon/quest/fate.*****************************************************************************What is Bad:Global Clock: All actions by players and mobs are on a global clock. This gives the game a somewhat turn based feel to it where everything is in time and synced together. Why is this bad? Because for more then a few classes in order to get the most out of your abilities you need to time them PERFECTLY based on this clock, and the fact that you can't see or interact with it means that you'll be guessing based on the countdown on your abilities. Best example of this being a problem is on the summoner Job, where timing your dots right makes the difference of 100% of your damage or 80% of your damage if you get it wrong.Insanely difficult dice roll quests: At end game, there is a series of quests to get your "best" weapon. This is... the most bull♥♥♥♥♥♥you will ever have to face in a game. You have to win 12 random dice rolls, and failing one means having to try again... Did I mention that each dice roll happens AFTER you finish one of the many random events around the world? That you have to wait up to 15 minutes for? Even with higher drop chance it is still Bull. (My best time for completing this quest.. 6 days, friend took more then 2 weeks) Lucky that this is optional.Character creation limitations: What's that? Wanna play with a friend who already plays the game? What's that? They are on the Levi Server? Well FK YOU! Servers every now and then (some more then others, to the point of being closed more often then open) will close their gate to new players, this is done to keep the servers from being over loaded, but this has the nasty side effect of keeping players from playing together on the servers they want, specially the more populated ones where you have more people to interact with and more options for guilds/fcs. Why is this done? Well that brings me to my last problem.Gold Spammers: Yup, the ever present MMO issue is here but 1000x worse. These pesky parasites will spam all chats, all areas, all the time. They even personally PM you with their virus ridden web links, promising massive amounts of gil for your hard earned money. This is done through the in game player search, where they just have to go alphabetically to find every single one of us and spam us one at a time. Of course they get banned, only to instantly make a new random name account and get right back into the game. they come in the thousands and they want all of your money, and in my opinion is the sole reason that servers are rotated the way they are. It's annoying, it's frustrating, and no mater how many of them you block there are always 5 more to take their place. Every now and then Square does a mass Hardware ban and that quiets them for a week or so wile they buy new computers/servers but it's only a temporary fix to a permanent problem.**********************************************************All in all, in my opinion, the good outweighs the bad. This game is an experience, an amazing experience. I've never had more fun with an MMO in my life and I'm not sure I ever will. No one would have thought that after the disaster that was the original FFXIV that this would be what comes out of it. I ask any of you reading, at LEAST give the 2 week free trial a chance. You have nothing to loose but a whole world to gain.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 7, 2016
												Sorry for this long review, if you dont wont to read, then all the other ine sentence reviews should convince you to get this game. this is pretty much just details on the game itself and my thoughts on them. i dont think i get really specific so if you wanna know more just go to the wiki or the play guide http://store.steampowered.com  Pros (in my opinion, obviously) Most Classic RPG experiance in an MMO that ive had in a while. its its pretty rare these days where you start off as an actual  normal adventurer and get quests from an adventurers guild. these days most mmos are just replica of "you are a chosen one! now go fight evil" sorta thing. The combat system is about the same as the standard good old formula, has som pretty animations for combat as well. The Gear and weapons have a nice aesthetic feeling to them and they get the look of the gear right as well, going from begginners gear to higher level gear, it actually matches what it looks like in comparison to the level. no flashy beginners gear. to bad that there is no costume slots so you can use the image of old gear, but most of them look great to begin with. A great part of the class mechanics is that once you reach lvl15 on your first class, you can choose to pick up any other class and conintue with that, of course starting from level one again. but if you dont want to do this you can always start a new character, since they give a generous amount of character slots per world (at least after the ifrst month of paid sub). The Story is quite typical of a final fantasy game, chocka block full of characters and plot. since i play most games while listening to something,  i usually dont pay much attention to what the npc's say and just follow quest obj, but this has probably been one of only 10 or so games that i dont do that. Animations, Graphics and Design of Final Fantasy 14 are quite good, if you look around you realise that every npc, wheteher they be friend or enemy, has a ton of idle animations and animations while being interacted with. for me who uses a pretty low end pc (basically what the minimum it states, maybe a bit lower) its still looks quite beautiful. The Environment and world itself is quite expansive,though it is section off into different regions. For example Thanalan (name of whole region) -> split into North, South East, e.t.c There is thankfully no game breaking pay to win gear. though there is gear that you can by with real money, its aesthetic stuff like mounts and costumes. basically all you can by with real money is -> The game itself + paid DLC ( which so far is only heavensward), the sub needed to play and aesthetic stuff like premium dyes, mounts, nostalgic costumes and little pets that will follow you around.Also if you happen to be a japanophile like me you can hav Jap audio with english sub. just saying, but theres nothing wrong with the english voice actors, they're acutally pretty good. Cons i wished that they would add more voices to the cutscenes and general talking to npcs, because so far only important mission cutscenes have voice.maybe no sub fee or a lower one, its pretty heavy on my wallet since i play alot. hahahasometimes around really big updates the launcher freaks out and does a bunch of erros and you'll end up redownloading it or searching the internet for an answer.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 3, 2016
												I strongly recommend this as an immersive, beautiful, extensively narrative-driven experience, to the point even the crafters and gatherers get their own storylines! While the combat is simplified, it's neither too simple nor too frustrating, and the native controller support is an absolute joy. More depth and complexity can be found in the crafting and gathering systems, although the game is still quite easy to understand.The world, while only consisting of a few maps, is gorgeous, memorable, and full of detail, both in characters and environment.The music is also fantastic, expressing a broad array of emotions, from the tender to the grand. The boss music as well is varied and intense and uses a variety of styles and instrumentation.Achievement hunters might find the game a bit of a grind, as some of the achievements are literally just grindwalls, especially the ones relating to the game's minigame hub, but the fact that most game systems have achievements attached to them, and the sheer array of activities that can be done, mean achievement-hunting is fairly involved and interesting from an intellectual point of view.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 11, 2015
												At this point, writing a review is a bit like asking Gordon Ramsay if he likes to cook. I have nearly 300 hours in this game as of writing, and I've enjoyed every single one of them. Also I manage perfectly well to balance my study with this game. If anything it actually IMPROVED my performance, it drives me to work harder during the day so I have more free time during the evenings to play.The good:+ Summarized: This game takes everything from other MMOs that works, strips out what doesn't work, and innovates on features in its own way.+ The dev team is very much aware that the original FFXIV had a horrible start, and their mantra is "earn and deserve the players' trust". They deliberately chose to keep the game subscription-based because it offers them and the players more stability.+ The cross-server Duty Finder lets you queue up for every form of cooperative content from wherever you are in the world.+ Big bonuses for people who repeat old content in the Duty Finder (sadly only once per day), to encourage keeping storyline content populated so you won't get stuck just because you can't find anyone to play with.+ Classes are varied and the handful I've tried are fun to play. At level 30, every class evolves into one or two Jobs that are even more specialized.+ You can train every class on a single character. In fact most Jobs have a secondary class requirement that also needs to be trained.+ There are two levels of subscription, Entry and Standard. Entry is cheaper than Standard, but doesn't allow recurring payments and restricts you to 1 character per server, 8 in total. But since you can just train every class on a single character anyway, this won't actually lock you out of anything.+ The world is beautiful and feels alive.+ The lore and story are of true Final Fantasy levels, and better than I've seen in any other MMO.+ The game tries to do that "chosen one in a world of chosen ones" that story-heavy MMOs are all guilty of, but actually executes it very well. In-storyline, your character becomes something of a living legend after a while, and everyone acknowledges that you faced off with terrible monsters and lived to tell the tale. When someone does question your skills in the storyline, it's usually because they actually are a fool.+ Boss battles are extremely memorable, and all have interesting mechanics.+ The music. Oh God, the music. The regular zone music is already plenty good and immersive, but the composer went completely wild with the dungeon and boss themes. Expect epic choires, punk rock and heavy metal. One boss in particular has 5 different phases, and every phase has its own song.'The middle:~ Truly understanding the mechanics of your class/job and the role you fulfill in party dynamic takes quite some time and willingness to learn. If someone gives you good advice, listen to it. I learned the most by making mistakes, and getting tips on what I should have done differently from people who were there with me. This process still continues today, and I only get better by it.The bad:- Levelling alternate classes gets quite grindy. You get massive XP boosts when you level classes that are below the level of your highest class, but even with that you'll need to invest a lot of time past level 30. Your primary class should be fine doing only Main Story Quests most of the time, at least until you reach Heavensward.- You start with a lot of inventory space and even an armoury chest to store your equipment in, but you will inevitably run into the limits of this with how many crafting materials there are in the game, and how many different sets of equipment you need if you play multiple classes. Rather than a bank the game features retainer NPCs which can do something to alleviate the burden, but I think the game would really benefit of a Guild Wars (2) type of crafting material specific storage.- There is a shortage of Tanks and Healers in the Duty Finder queues. But this isn't really the game's fault, and multi-classing makes it easy to just ask a friend to jump in for a role if you really can't find anyone.- Not all parts of the story are equally good, and some characters are very annoying.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 24, 2014
												Having played (and still am playing) World of Warcraft I've been over the MMO market to find one as fun as WoW. Warhammer Online didnt work for me, The Old Republic had nothing in the way of content (also its Star Wars, don't heavily like the series), Maple Story was ok in small doses, and Tera, while pretty, has one♥♥♥♥♥♥community.So while I knew of the original FFXI I never played it and got the basics from hearsay, and the original launch of FFXIV left me glad I had no interest, cut to the present and SE decided to pull it, rework the game, and with Naoki Yoshida's wonderful direction remade and released a truly fantastic MMO that reminded me of the first time I played WoW.Eorzea literally grabbed me like Azeroth first did and I was everywhere, I had my first timer bungles yes, but the game is fair in its guidance and shows you where to go. Dungeons are only 4 people instead of a traditional 5 but that also seems to help on content as with 5 you could have one person carry everything with 4 everyone must pull their own weight. Dungeons offer a fine line of challenge, reward, and ease, you do a hard mode dungeon, wipe on a boss several times but push it more and eventually kill it and get loot and no one is mad but glad? Always wonderful. While young, the games raiding is solid if needs just a bit more tweaking, not I have not done Coil so I cant speak on those as I know they are quite challenging but it all works well and wonderful.Overall I got my monthly payment of enjoyment, and with the developers constantly working on new content for everyone to do it doesnt get stale, also PLAYER HOUSING!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 28, 2016
												I've played quite a few MMORPG's, and Final Fantasy XIV is one of the best I have ever playedDuring the content draught in World of Warcraft during the Warlords of Draenor expansion, I decided to give this game a shot and it was totally worth it! Though, this game is different from other MMO's as in there is a 2 second Global Cooldown, which may take some getting used to if you've played lots of other MMO's, another thing that is different is that their is a huge emphasis on story. In order to unlock dungeons/raids/etc. you HAVE to do the Main Story Quests. For example, once you get to level 50, you aren't able to just immediantly hop into the Heavensward expansion, you have to do the rest of the quests from the vanilla game, including quests that were added in patches. It may seem like it kinda sucks, but it really isn't bad and I personally enjoyed it, though I will admit that this isn't for everybody.(Note: I only have 8 hours of gameplay because I originally played the non-steam version of the game, but then bought it on Steam so that I could track gametime.)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 24, 2016
												Disclaimer: I have never played any other Final Fantasy game prior to this so my knowledge or opinion of lore is irrelevant to this reviewI've been playing MMOs since 2006, and this is my first subscription based game. I started FFXIV by being bribed by my Guild Wars 2 friends to raid with them. Graphic wise this game is great after being relaunched in 2.0. Gameplay compared to most other MMOs may be slow until you pick up your job, but plays nicely at endgame content. FFXIV offers great cross platform play, accessibility and customization for both the PC and PS4 platform. However, the game still lacks a lot of Quality of Life features such as a wardrobe or dye system from Guild Wars 2. Whether you're a lore consumer, MMO casual, or hardcore raider. If you are fine with paying a ~$15 subscription fee for hundreds or thousands of hours in an MMO, FFXIV can be an MMO for you.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 28, 2015
												Oh how long it has taken for me to actually recommend this game.I would be embarrased if this thing would show my playtime with PS3 too. :PWould probably be going around 10k. '-' I think I am being too humble with my playtime guesses.So I started playing this game almost right after 'A Realm Reborn' had come out and it has been nice to see this game improve so much and even nicer to see that it has improved from the flop of an original Final Fantasy XIV.I will go through cons first, because they were easier and shorter to list:- Leveling can be quite annoying and slow (if you aren't into grinding a lot)- Combat can feel like you are spamming the same abilities all the time. Exception to this are usually highend raids.- If you aren't into crafting things or gathering materials, you will probably have a hard time earning gil (money)- Even though the class system is really nice, it feels like some of the classes are better than others in the sense of outgoing damage.- Damage dealers (DPS) usually have to wait really long (around 10-30 minutes usually) to get in to a dungeon or a raid unless you have a premade team. (this is not the games fault to be honest, just too many people as DPS)- Quests are usually boring. Exception to this are "unique quests" that have cutscenes or something different than the usual 'fetch, gather, kill' quests.That's all I can think of.Pros will probably be much longer, because I have so many good things to say:- NOT A PAY-TO-WIN GAME. <3 Pay-to-play tho- Graphics are really beautiful- Class system is really nice. You can change from healer to tank to damage dealer anytime you want to.- Really beautiful world... like one would expect from a Square Enix game.- Races are really diverse. You can be a kitty, dragonish person, tiny midget baby, an elf as tall as a building, a wall-like orc or just a meh human.- Dungeons are really pretty and primals (standalone bosses) look really interesting. There's a boss that looks like a stone... made out of stone.- I forgot to mention music early on, so let's just add it here. Music is really beautiful. Opening scenes have the best songs imo.- Big updates about every 2-3 months, little updates like some quests about every month.- You can magically make your ugly costumes beautiful... or your beautiful costumes ugly. You do you.- You can gamble. Tho it's not as addictive as FFXIII-2's slotmachines. :P- Specified Limit Breaks for every damage dealing class look awesome. If you are a healer left alone with your team dead and your team has full lvl 3 limit break, you can bring everybody back to life with full health. Not broken.- You can be lazy and do level 30 dungeon with level 60 character solo to get loot for my other classes. B)I am too lazy to write more pros, but maybe someday I will finish this list.Anyway, if you are thinking of buying this game... BUY IT.If you are thinking of moving from a console to Steam version like I did... DO IT. Much easier to get playtime or other cosmetic stuff.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 23, 2016
												Final Fantasy XIV is a good game. Visually it looks amazing and the gameplay is really fun. However there are a couple things that take it away from being at the top spots for MMO's i've played. Firstly the world size, although there are plenty of zones to explore they are all instanced. This means to go between each zone requires a loading screen which doesn't seem that bad but there also 2 areas in each major city meaning you have to load every time between them. Also unlike other MMO's the zones feel rather restricting. By that I mean that there's a set area you can walk in and there's a lot of predetermined areas you can't walk over where its just an invisible wall all the way around the object instead of letting you freely explore over it. This is minor really but it makes the world feel smaller.Secondly questing. Before you can move on in the game at all you must complete the Main Story Quests with over 180 between level 1 and 50. Once at 50 you have to play through exactly 100 more quests before you can even enter or use anything heavenward related. The quests still continue after that currently going post 60. This quest system isn't bad but after getting to 50 you have to spend way to much time going through pointless quests unless your interested in the storyline.Now that aside it is a really fun game. It has a fun class system which allows you to have 1 of every class on one character allowing you to switch between them when your not busy. Each of them requiring its own leveling. This system means that your not tied to one class and allows ou to play what's needed at the time. The boss fights are really fun with the Sync system meaning even people higher level than the boss will be synced with gear and level to help you so you get a more rea experience as to what it was like to do it when it was first released. Lastly just look at this game it looks stunning and that's all that has to be said on that.I would recommend this game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 5
												I don't have an extreme amount of hours but I feel like I have a decent amount to write a review for it. I have been hunting for a good MMO for a very long time. I came across this game before and to be honest it was a little different than most MMO's that I have played and I was a little confused with how everything worked so the first month I just got scared off and went to hunting again. Months later I said you know what I'll give it another shot, I actually took some time to get through the game and I currently have a level 50 Monk and 45 Ninja. This MMO is absolutely phenomenal if you just give it a chance. Almost every MMO I have tried in the past year+ I have just left after a couple days but this game I cannot get away from. There are so many things to do in this game and the Community is honestly the best I've had in an MMO. You don't get punished or talked down to for doing bad or messing something up 99% of the time, people understand you are new and would rather teach you through it so you know for next time and guide you on what to do and what not to do while playing in a Dungeon, or just playing your class in general. For a pay to play title it is very much worth the money to get. If you don't believe me just read the reviews with the players that have over 5000+ hours. But this is coming from someone fairly new to the game so I have a solid say as I am not end game yet, but from what I have heard the end game gets even MORE addicting! Which I am excited about.Pros:- This game is BEAUTIFUL for it's age, honestly it's absolutely amazing- The Community is great from what I have experienced so far, last community in a game I found so great was City of Heroes- The STORY, I won't mention anything in the Story itself but, The beginning there is no voice overs but as you go along there's actual Voice Dialogue and it's GOOD- SO Many Classes, and you can swap classes ON THE FLY, one character can be all classes at once, no need to make a new character for each class- Cross Class Skills - High level players can play with lower levels in the low level dungeons at any given time! So you can jump in and help with anyone new you play with- The Classes are actually COMPLEX, you don't just sit there and button mash your best skills, you have rotations and you play the class how it is MEANT to be played unlike most games- CONTROLLER SUPPORT, ALSO THIS GAME IS CROSS PLATFORM WITH PS4- The music is awesome and helps the game feel like a Final Fantasy Game- Some Dungeons bosses actually have moves you gotta learn to dodge and mechanics you gotta learn in order to complete it successfully without wiping, making it more fun than just tank and spank. Not EVERY boss has mechanics though- The game gradually teaches you how to play your role with class specific quests, and a novice training hall for your role- Fat ChocoboCons:- WE NEED MORE TANKS AND HEALERS- The quests can get a tad bit repetitive but trust me you'll get through them- Not as much of a casual sit back and play game, you need all attention if you wanna do good in the end game content- Early on the game feels really slow and trust me I felt it, but when you gain more skills and get to farther content you won't feel as bad- Glamouring your items (aka: reskinning your armour to make your own look requires you to be level 50)- Inventory is too small in my opinion- RMT SpamMixed:- Side Quests are almost necessary your first time playing through, if you don't do it you will be underlevelled for some of content and will have to grind out Mobs/Fates/Etc- Crafting can be complex to some plays, you either really enjoy it or you tend to push away as far as possible fromNote that there are a lot more I can list for both Pro's and Con's but I honestly can't think of anymore on the top of my head. This game is Amazing in my opinion and is my favourite MMO at this point. I will update if I can think of anything else though!Give it a shot guys I highly recommend it.Note: I have not even accessed Heavensward yet so this is solely based on A Realm Reborn!

content:
Posted: January 20
												I have too much love for this game to be able to summarize it in words. It's an MMO with story, fantastic music, adventure, epic battles even at lower levels, deep combat, plenty of good humor, and enough weeaboo garbage for everyone. If you're looking for any of these things, Final Fantasy XIV has it all in spades, with longevity to boot. This game never gets old. The monthly sub fee is 200% worth it. And if you're a long time fan of the franchise like me, you'll enjoy this game all the more. Such a pure gaming experience. Please, try it.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 6
												Of all the MMORPGs out there, Final Fantasy XIV has one of the most in-depth, incredible stories. This is the closest to its roots Final Fantasy has felt in many years, and I highly recommend it. Between character customization and the main story quests, there is plenty of content that non-MMO players can play with little to no need for other players interference. And for those who like the social aspect, there are Free Company's (guilds), lots of dungeons, and an amazing community of players from around the world looking to have fun and make friends. All in all, this is an amazing game, and I recommend it to anyone looking for a golden years Final Fantasy experience.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 2, 2016
												Who wouldn't love a miqo'te?*This is my first proper review*Final Fantasy XIV is something that will change your point of view on MMORPGs -- it will broaden your vision. This is something I only came to realize recently, from being away from the game for a while. You'll just want back, because you're addicted.FFXIV is simply put LOVE. The amazing soundtracks, the stunning visuals, the challenging combat... it's all there, and it's all in harmony. Nothing fights with each other.Pros:-- the stunning visuals (even on low-end PCs the game looks beautiful. thank you cross-platform)-- the amazing music. you'll find yourself listening to it and being sucked into it (it might get boring though, if you spam a specific dungeon many times *I just listen to music while raiding*)-- the world. it's beautiful.-- challenging combat system (I say challenging because of complex skill rotations - especially on DPS classes. and all those damned AOEs) that will not make you bored. the fights require your unshaken, full attention (unless you're a healer in a 4-man dungeon...))-- great variety of mounts and cosmetics-- no p2w in sight.-- friendly community, no matter where you are.-- newbie friendly. it doesn't matter if this is your first MMORPG or 10th, you'll learn your way within the game.-- really well thought out gathering and crafting system that works and gets you the gil (in-game currency).-- the game's rich main story will break your heart. the amazing, funny side story quests won't leave you bored either.-- the game is friendly towards different players. casual? you got it. medcore? you got it. hardcore? you got it. PVP? you got it!Cons:-- the dungeons' replayability can get dull over time. leveling up your sixth class and lashing out at the possible newbies in your party? that's a no-no, no matter how annoyed you are. you were once at similar situations too. you were, and still are, learning.-- silly run from point A to point B, then back to point A and through point C to point D just to turn in the quest at point B-quests are somewhat annoying if you are looking forward to progress in the game.-- character creation lacks in not letting you to edit more than the face and boobs (and tail). you can still create very unique characters, though personally I am not a fan of skinny legs. damn japanese.-- maps are locked. as in, you cannot jump off the ledge of a cliff. there's an invisible wall (though there are some secrets...)-- gilspammers (goldsellers) and the very laid-back measurements taken to counter them.Overall, the game is perfect even with its imperfections. The devs are very hard working and as the game has not been around for very long -it just recently got its first expansion pack- I think they deserve a round of applause. Get the game and get sucked in it. It's well worth its monthly fee and I will continue playing this masterpiece.It's unique and it will go a long way.P.S. I want my life back. </3

content:
Posted: February 28
												This game is literally the best MMO I ever played. I bought it while on sale during christmas days and not a day has passed since where I haven't played. The character creation has not as many options as others,but still enough to customize a decent character. The monthly fee for playing (13€) us worth paying. There's a lot to do and discover: One character can have all classes and jobs,there's no need for an endless character list. Also the character is perfectly integrated in cutscenes and the english translation of the story is well-made aswell as the translation for other stuff (e. g. open world events [FATEs]). Also the game has a beautiful world graphic wise,it just feels good to walk/mount through.Every area has it's own style.Gameplaywise it's the basic MMO thing: you use your skills and your chara does autoattacks,but every class is made interesting with it's own features. For example Conjurer (cleric): They have a skill wich switches their healingstat with their magdmg stat and increases magdmg by 10%/reduces healing by 20%,wich makes them great to play solo,unlike in other MMOs. Also the NPC-Mentors of all classes are vbery memorable and characteristic,the dialogues all are worth reading.Conclusion:This game is worth it. Once you start playing it,you will be able to feel how much love and detail was put into the game (except that long hair still glitches through some clothing),in music,dialogues,the landscapes and also the story.And you will learn how to love and hate characters and bosses at the same time.

												This MMO is a lot of fun, and the setting, storyline, and graphics are great. The group finder is a nice addition and makes finding groups for dungeons and raids very simple. 												At this moment my time of playing is showing something like 17 hours, however I have more than 1000h since I used to play on PS4 and usually I just start the game from the boot so it doesn't count the time on steam. So, let's get down to it then:In Final Fantasy XIV prepare for a journey that will not only make you waste your whole life while playing, lose your job, lose your girlfriend and even your friends. This game changed my view on online gaming and it's honestly the first and probably only game I will ever pay monthly subs. About the quest lines, it has absolutely the best stories I have ever seen in a MMORPG, and the stunning graphics also make you feel like you're truly in Eorzea. Speaking of which, Eorzea is a fantastic world that will make you even stop sometimes to apreciate the views.I cannot recommend any MMORPG more than this one, and yes, I have quite some log time on ESO too.Bottom line is: If you're on edge about buying this game or not, take a leap of faith and just do. You won't regret it.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 26, 2016
												I'd been waiting to write a review for this game until I had played through the whole thing, but then got sucked into the expansion. As a little background, I'm an experienced MMO player and a leader in an online gaming community. I won't bore you with the exhaustive list of MMOs I've played, but we've been around and seen what the genre has to offer!For those who prefer a TLDR, here it is:-FFXIV is one of the best MMOs I've ever played, even taking into account the sub fee. The level of content support for this game is also on an entirely different level. Don't hesitate to download the trial and try it out!  Just remember the challenge comes as you get further in!For those who prefer a thorough breakdown of strengths and weaknesses, including all major aspects of the game, read on!  I will break this down as succinctly as I can, but bear with me, because this game is unbelievably massive in terms of content vs. age.*Disclaimer* This game is a Story Driven MMORPG. If you don't enjoy reading through the main scenario quests or watching any of the many cutscenes, you can certainly find content that is to your liking, but you will be playing only a portion of the game and missing some of the best parts. While it does start out slow, I promise the story evolves into one of the best MMO stories I've ever played, excepting perhaps Star Wars: The Old Republic.Pro's:-Excellent Story that will engage you and make the world come to life. Especially once you get nearer to the first expansion.-Best Class System of ANY MMO. One character can separately level any or ALL classes in the game. No needing a new character to try out a different class. You can switch on the fly at any time outside dungeons and not in combat, complete with saved gear for that class spec. Special inventory for armor also eliminates the impact of this system on your character for needing to carry XX sets of gear. Cross-class abilities give you a good reason to level additional classes without it being mandatory.-Exquisite Musical Scores. No, really. Final Fantasy is known for delivering moving music, but they outdid themselves on many of the scores in this game. Especially in the expansion. I have found myself just standing there and listening in-game without intending to.-Most Impressive Crafting System in Any MMO. I know this is an easy claim to make and a hard one to back up, but crafting in this game IS a game of it's own. Providing all details of the crafting system would take an entire review of its own, so I'll try to hit the highlights. Crafting can matter! The older crafting content is useful for new players, cross class leveling for existing players, and cosmetic appearance that allows you to overlay one piece of gear with the look of another (the cosmetic crafted gear is some of the best looking gear in the game). New content is often nearly as powerful as current endgame gear, and is EXCEEDINGLY challenging to make. You also have things to make such as buffs and housing items for the public housing systems to show off in your guild house and/or neighborhood.  -Graphics. This is one of the few MMOs that can be played in 4K. Although it was designed for lower resolutions, you definitely notice a major difference. Even without 4k, the game is stunning. Well designed environments full of content truly immerse you in the world.-The Amount of Content. Flat. Out. Massive. This game has 14 large areas that stay relevant throughout your experience of playing the game. Even after completing the game, those areas are useful for finding rare monsters (Hunts) that reward you with current tier tokens for gear (which are always kept current). It also has 3 major cities and a theme park (more on that next). The scale of all the quests and content that can be explored is amazing and will keep exploration player types busy for a long time. Add to that a total of 21 dungeons, and 10 Hard Mode variations, and it's quite daunting for completionists. As an aside, those hard modes are complete reworks of the originals with different layouts new enemies and their own stories, not just a rehash of the originals like so many games use. Did I mention 20 Raids, and 27 Trials (Raid-like single boss fights)? Oh, and this is just a review for the base game, so that is NOT counting all the content in the expansion!-Do you like Minigames? Beware this game, because you'll forget to play the rest of it. The Gold Saucer (Theme Park from FFVII) has a number of quick minigames, a regular appearance of special activities, Chocobo Racing, a game-wide collectable card game with regular tournaments, a weekly lottery, and even an RTS game (similar to StarCraft/Warcraft, though not as complex) you play using your minions (cosmetic pets earned from many places in the game). The chocobo racing even has it's own leveling system for your race chocobos AND a breeding system to raise new birds. The collectable card game can be played with MANY NPC's throughout the rest of the game and around the world. They are all multiplayer compatable.-Gameplay. While some classes do have similarities, mostly they all play very differently to one another. Black mages go from burning all their mana on damaging fire cycles to regenerating it a super speed on Ice cycles. Dark Knights balance a similar process, but it revolves around offensive vs. defensive capabilities while tanking. Astrologians search for the best beneficial temporary buffs while keeping up with healing. This combined with more challenging content later in the game in dungeons and raids (and optional extra difficult versions) keeps you engaged at any skill level.Cons:-Inventory. While the robust class system is supported by your special inventory for gear (your Armoury), there are an insane number of items in this game. Especially for crafters/gatherers. They have said there are plans in the works to improve this issue with the next expansion, Stormblood, in Summer 2017, but meanwhile, this remains one of the biggest daily irritations in the game. If you don't craft or harvest, you probably won't care much.-Bots. I'm only listing this here because, not long ago, the amount of spam tells you would receive was horrible.  However, they recently put an additional system in to allow people to report RMT spammers as soon as one person receives a /tell. This is used to quickly lock out spamming accounts. I went from dozens of spam tells over a couple hours of play to maybe one a week.  ...Maybe. This issue is solved.-PvP. They DO have PvP. However, it's not the best PvP I've ever played. It's not the worst, either, and they do put a lot of effort in to try to keep classes balanced with how their abilities work in PvP and have continuing tournaments all the time with new scenarios/maps on an infrequent basis. However, I didn't find it interesting, and I usually love PvP. I will give them points for making sure PvP balance does NOT affect PvE content. Your abilities have different uses in PvP content.  This has been a huge issue in some other games.-Lack of Early Grouping Content. This is NOT a game that you can jump in and do a lot of content with your friends. Until about level 15 in the Main Scenario quests, about the only content you can group with your friends for is FATES (a public quest system) and sidequests. However, if you spend all your time grouping in those, you'll level well, but not unlock any content, since nearly evrything is unlocked via the Main Story quests, including higher level dungeons (since all dungeons are part of the story). This can be a turn-off for many new players with gaming buddies already playing. My advice is stick with it and just do Main Story quests while your friends make you some gear for level 20+. ;-)That about covers the highlights of the Pro's and Con's. I will try to respond to any questions regarding particular aspects of the game in the comments.

content:
Posted: February 6
												Now, I know it probably seems a little early for me to leave a review on this game, considering how I`ve only played around 30+ hours, but I feel like I have done enough research on this game to form an honest and factual opinion. So here we go!Pros*Square Enix provides impressive support for this game, servers rarely go down at all, and I have yet to encounter big lag issues, even when engaged in massive battles with multiple players and enemies.*Class system: probably one of the best systems I have seen in an MMO, and trust me, I have played a lot of them. You essentially only need one character. You can switch between classes on the fly, as long as you have the class set with you, and individually level each one up. This completely removes the need for alt-accounts, as you can basically become every single class in the game on one character.*Healthy playerbase: There are many people playing this game, and it`s not uncommon to find yourself surrounded by hundreds of players in the capital cities.*Friendly playerbase: The community surrounding this game is shockingly friendly, and open to almost anyone. After playing for only two hours, I was invited to a guild by a complete stranger, and all of my guildmates were extremely helpful, and taught me how the different systems in the game worked. Also, there is almost always at least one or two dudes ready to help you, if you for instance need some teammates for a dungeon.*Good subscription-based MMO: This game utilizes one of the best subscription-based services I have seen to date. There is so much value and gameplay to get here, and the monthly fee isn`t overly expensive either.*Story: The story in this game is probably one of the best stories I have ever seen in an MMO. After playing for a while, I found myself looking forward to doing the next quest, only so I could see how the story would unfold. Fair warning though: It does take some time to get into the meat of things, but once you do, you will find yourself captivated by the world and its characters.*End-game raids: The 24-man raids and events you can do once you hit max level, are quite frankly fantastic. The awe-inspiring bosses, the cool dungeons and locations, the beautiful music and the level of teamwork needed to complete each raid is simply perfect. Final Fantasy XIV has always boasted itself on it`s amazing end-game raids, and I must truly say, it definitely lives up to its promise!*Beautiful music: Many of the locations in this game have terrific music, and sometimes, I find myself listening to the soundtracks alone whilst doing homework or other tasks. From the soothing vibes of the jungle to the intense music of boss-battles, Square Enix really put some incredibly hard work into the scores in this game.*Cross-platform play: PC-players can play with players from both the PS3 and PS4 version, and vice versa. A very nice thing if one of your friends happens to own the game on a console instead of a PC.Cons*Dungeons and Raids queue time: Sometimes, it can take up to half an hour to get into a dungeon or raid if you are soloing. Especially annoying if your current quest involves completing a dungeon. You basically cannot progress further into the story unless you beat the dungeon first, which can involve sitting through a queue-time of up to 30 minutes or longer (if you don`t have any friends or guildmates to help you).*Gil (currency) sellers: Now, I know that this is pretty much a common thing in MMO`s these days, but that doesn`t make it any less annoying. If you find yourself in one of the main cities during "rush hour" (when there is the biggest amount of players online), it is not uncommon to see the chat bar filling up with spam messages about selling Gil. This is extremely annoying if you are for instance trying to have a conversation with another player. Your messages get lost in a sea of spam, and you basically have to party up, only to utilize the party-chat so you can actually see what the other person is writing.*Boring "fetch" or "kill" quests: There are quite a few standard "go here and kill 5 of these", or "bring this item to this NPC" quests littered throughout the game. This is a pretty common thing in MMO`s these days, but still, it`s worth mentioning.*PvP: Very long PvP queues and few players. Also slightly unbalanced. I don`t really do PvP all that much, so this doesn`t bother me, but if you are one of those people who loves PvP, then this might put you off.*End-game (yes it`s here too): The end-game in Final Fantasy XIV can be very grindy and tedious at times. You might have to redo the same raid or dungeon multiple times only to get the gear or item you want. Most of the end-game is built up around raids and dungeons, so if that isn`t your thing, then there really isn`t much point in continuing to play after you hit max level, except for maybe to level up alternative classes.ConclusionFinal Fantasy XIV: A Realm Reborn might be one of the best MMO`s I have ever played. It has a great class system, steady support from the developers, awesome end-game raids, a friendly and healthy community, a great story, beautiful music and cross-platform play. I am extremely happy that I decided to start playing this game, and I can`t see myself stopping any time soon!

Posted: February 26
												This is by far the best MMORPG of all time. Yoshi does an amazing job of being the lead director for this game, and his fanfests causes people to go ape♥♥♥♥♥♥with happiness. 11/10 would tap Yoshi.FFXIV is a MMORPG that involves a character to level up all the classes/jobs in the game to max level, do story, dungeons, raids, primals, dailies, relic weapon questing. Honestly, typical MMORPG♥♥♥♥♥♥ But the way it is done, is quite refreshing and amazing. When there is problems with the game, yoshi and the devs listen to the community and do everything they can to fix the problem, they even address it to everyone to help make sure no one falls into the same problems.While, there is minimal pvp and it's still being worked on because yoshi cares about us.Honestly, the only issue with this game is pretty much the community. The community has a wide variety of people...  75% of the time you will witness the nicest of all people that will go out of their way to help you out, talk to you, roleplay(if you are into that.), if you are feeling down... talk to you to attempt to help you feel better, it's a REALLY NICE COMMUNITY. But, that 15 to 25% that linger... is literally the cancer of all cancers, they sometimes makes WoW Trade chat look like a decent place where your brain cells stop attempting to kill themselves. These cancers are literally caused by inbreds who think they are cool and funny kids. They will harass people, they will act all big and down people even though they only have one maxed out class and nothing else worked on.  There is PvE elitists who harass others all the time, Feminazi's, and there is social media kids...oh god them. When you meet them which is like said 15 to 25% of the time, you will wish that they would get perma banned or worse. Honestly, everyone does this, if they deny this then they are lying... trust me, I have pals who play this game with me one of them is one of the nicest females to ever touch MMORPG's and she wished terrible things upon meeting one of the cancers.This game is literally 9/10. It should honestly be 10/10. IT'S LITERALLY AMAZING. PLAY IT. NOW. The cancerous part of the community is pretty much the only thing that holds this game back but at least it is 15 to 25% of the time. Oh, and it's not Pay to win or free to play.Also, I tend to download this game through the website and play it as a non-steam game than download it through steam. It's just my preference, I know it's weird, but... I have at least more than a thousand hours on this game.I'd like to add that SE tends to ♥♥♥♥ over the playerbase of all final fantasy... at least Yoshi doesn't want to screw us over.

content:
Posted: November 16, 2016
												As someone who hasn't really given MMOs a fair shot as a genre due to not having a huge interest in it from the get-go and being a bit skeptical of pay subscription models, I am very glad that I was talked into picking this up by a friend. It is by far one of the most enjoyable games I have ever played, and having only picked up the game last week (at time of writing), the 27.8 hours that I already have logged in should be considered as a good indicator of just how enjoyable this game is, and how easy it is to be entralled in the universe that is Final Fantasy XIV: A Realm Reborn. Due to my inexperience with the genre, perhaps I lack the keen eye to be able to spot what makes an MMO truly great. But as a newcomer to the genre, and perhaps yourself too being on the fence on whether to try this MMO out, hopefully my words are relatable and equally as helpful as those who are veteran MMO players: Pros: - Stunning visuals;- Class Fluidity (being able to change classes on the fly; not having to worry about being pidgeon-holed into a class forever);- Many classes and subclasses to choose from; variety ranging from combat, magic, trades, and artisan roles;- Engaging storyline; - Free 30-Days game time for newcomers;- Very healthy population for a game that is already 3 years old;- New content, patches and expansions still being released by developers (new expansion coming in 2017 for e.g.)- Good guild support (in the game they are known as 'Free Companies');- Party System to play with friends;- Support for both Mouse and Keyboard, and Gamepad play; - Player-run economies (nice bit of micro-economics between players if they wish to use their classes to develop products/ items and sell to others in order to make a bit of money. Also makes for good banter between friends); - Nice balance of PvE and PvP content - you can quite easily enjoy both or pick one or the other if that's what you prefer.Cons: - Voice acting is a little lacking but otherwise great; there will be times often enough where you are just reading lines of text which can be a bit boring and/or skippingly tedious;- Game is arguably and substantially more enjoyable with friends than it is without.

content:
Posted: December 28, 2016
												I've played quite a few MMORPG's, and Final Fantasy XIV is one of the best I have ever playedDuring the content draught in World of Warcraft during the Warlords of Draenor expansion, I decided to give this game a shot and it was totally worth it! Though, this game is different from other MMO's as in there is a 2 second Global Cooldown, which may take some getting used to if you've played lots of other MMO's, another thing that is different is that their is a huge emphasis on story. In order to unlock dungeons/raids/etc. you HAVE to do the Main Story Quests. For example, once you get to level 50, you aren't able to just immediantly hop into the Heavensward expansion, you have to do the rest of the quests from the vanilla game, including quests that were added in patches. It may seem like it kinda sucks, but it really isn't bad and I personally enjoyed it, though I will admit that this isn't for everybody.(Note: I only have 8 hours of gameplay because I originally played the non-steam version of the game, but then bought it on Steam so that I could track gametime.)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 23, 2016
												Final Fantasy XIV is a good game. Visually it looks amazing and the gameplay is really fun. However there are a couple things that take it away from being at the top spots for MMO's i've played. Firstly the world size, although there are plenty of zones to explore they are all instanced. This means to go between each zone requires a loading screen which doesn't seem that bad but there also 2 areas in each major city meaning you have to load every time between them. Also unlike other MMO's the zones feel rather restricting. By that I mean that there's a set area you can walk in and there's a lot of predetermined areas you can't walk over where its just an invisible wall all the way around the object instead of letting you freely explore over it. This is minor really but it makes the world feel smaller.Secondly questing. Before you can move on in the game at all you must complete the Main Story Quests with over 180 between level 1 and 50. Once at 50 you have to play through exactly 100 more quests before you can even enter or use anything heavenward related. The quests still continue after that currently going post 60. This quest system isn't bad but after getting to 50 you have to spend way to much time going through pointless quests unless your interested in the storyline.Now that aside it is a really fun game. It has a fun class system which allows you to have 1 of every class on one character allowing you to switch between them when your not busy. Each of them requiring its own leveling. This system means that your not tied to one class and allows ou to play what's needed at the time. The boss fights are really fun with the Sync system meaning even people higher level than the boss will be synced with gear and level to help you so you get a more rea experience as to what it was like to do it when it was first released. Lastly just look at this game it looks stunning and that's all that has to be said on that.I would recommend this game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 5
												I don't have an extreme amount of hours but I feel like I have a decent amount to write a review for it. I have been hunting for a good MMO for a very long time. I came across this game before and to be honest it was a little different than most MMO's that I have played and I was a little confused with how everything worked so the first month I just got scared off and went to hunting again. Months later I said you know what I'll give it another shot, I actually took some time to get through the game and I currently have a level 50 Monk and 45 Ninja. This MMO is absolutely phenomenal if you just give it a chance. Almost every MMO I have tried in the past year+ I have just left after a couple days but this game I cannot get away from. There are so many things to do in this game and the Community is honestly the best I've had in an MMO. You don't get punished or talked down to for doing bad or messing something up 99% of the time, people understand you are new and would rather teach you through it so you know for next time and guide you on what to do and what not to do while playing in a Dungeon, or just playing your class in general. For a pay to play title it is very much worth the money to get. If you don't believe me just read the reviews with the players that have over 5000+ hours. But this is coming from someone fairly new to the game so I have a solid say as I am not end game yet, but from what I have heard the end game gets even MORE addicting! Which I am excited about.Pros:- This game is BEAUTIFUL for it's age, honestly it's absolutely amazing- The Community is great from what I have experienced so far, last community in a game I found so great was City of Heroes- The STORY, I won't mention anything in the Story itself but, The beginning there is no voice overs but as you go along there's actual Voice Dialogue and it's GOOD- SO Many Classes, and you can swap classes ON THE FLY, one character can be all classes at once, no need to make a new character for each class- Cross Class Skills - High level players can play with lower levels in the low level dungeons at any given time! So you can jump in and help with anyone new you play with- The Classes are actually COMPLEX, you don't just sit there and button mash your best skills, you have rotations and you play the class how it is MEANT to be played unlike most games- CONTROLLER SUPPORT, ALSO THIS GAME IS CROSS PLATFORM WITH PS4- The music is awesome and helps the game feel like a Final Fantasy Game- Some Dungeons bosses actually have moves you gotta learn to dodge and mechanics you gotta learn in order to complete it successfully without wiping, making it more fun than just tank and spank. Not EVERY boss has mechanics though- The game gradually teaches you how to play your role with class specific quests, and a novice training hall for your role- Fat ChocoboCons:- WE NEED MORE TANKS AND HEALERS- The quests can get a tad bit repetitive but trust me you'll get through them- Not as much of a casual sit back and play game, you need all attention if you wanna do good in the end game content- Early on the game feels really slow and trust me I felt it, but when you gain more skills and get to farther content you won't feel as bad- Glamouring your items (aka: reskinning your armour to make your own look requires you to be level 50)- Inventory is too small in my opinion- RMT SpamMixed:- Side Quests are almost necessary your first time playing through, if you don't do it you will be underlevelled for some of content and will have to grind out Mobs/Fates/Etc- Crafting can be complex to some plays, you either really enjoy it or you tend to push away as far as possible fromNote that there are a lot more I can list for both Pro's and Con's but I honestly can't think of anymore on the top of my head. This game is Amazing in my opinion and is my favourite MMO at this point. I will update if I can think of anything else though!Give it a shot guys I highly recommend it.Note: I have not even accessed Heavensward yet so this is solely based on A Realm Reborn!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 6
												Of all the MMORPGs out there, Final Fantasy XIV has one of the most in-depth, incredible stories. This is the closest to its roots Final Fantasy has felt in many years, and I highly recommend it. Between character customization and the main story quests, there is plenty of content that non-MMO players can play with little to no need for other players interference. And for those who like the social aspect, there are Free Company's (guilds), lots of dungeons, and an amazing community of players from around the world looking to have fun and make friends. All in all, this is an amazing game, and I recommend it to anyone looking for a golden years Final Fantasy experience.

content:
Posted: November 22, 2016
												FINAL FANTASY® XIV: A Realm Reborn™(My hours in-game are not representative as I have played the game off steam a lot longer)If I had to describe the game in one sentence: "One of the best MMORPG's out there, beautiful, challenging, complete!""In the beginning there was Final Fantasy XIV, and it was not good. For most games, the story would’ve ended there. But Square Enix, perhaps feeling that its prized franchise's name was in danger of becoming too literal, undertook a mammoth effort to keep Final Fantasy’s legacy from being marred by such a disaster. Final Fantasy XIV: A Realm Reborn is the resulting do-over, and it’s a huge success on PC, PlayStation 3, and PlayStation 4. Beautiful, fun, and only a bit uneven in the late game, this dramatic reinvention easily establishes itself as one of the most sincere and effective apologies in gaming history." - IGN"The juggernaut Final Fantasy XI grew into was a tough act to follow, but no one predicted such a spectacular failure. Square Enix took note and responsibility and made a resolution to learn from its past mistakes, releasing Final Fantasy XIV: A Realm Reborn as a "rebirth" of sorts for the massively multiplayer online role-playing game that could. It has used its own personal Phoenix Down to come back fully revitalized, and the gorgeous new MMORPG is now a bustling world filled with curious players ready to get lost in it." - GAMESPOT"Final Fantasy XIV Online, massively multiplayer online role-playing game — an MMO barely alive. Square Enix rebuilt it. They had the technology. They had the capability to build the world's first relaunched FF title. A Realm Reborn is that game. Better than it was before. Better, stronger, faster." - KOTAKU"Final Fantasy XIV Online was a unique experience.""Supreme. The best MMORPG""Can't stop playing!" - FansIf my opinion has any value, FFXIV Online is a great game from many aspects. I do not like getting into gameplay details. That is part of the fun in discovering a new game. It is game that will continue to grow and I recommend it without any doubt!Take it easy!!

												there are many fun things to do in Final Fantasy XIV Online: A Realm Reborn, Heavensward patch 3.4 Soul Surrender but to tell you the truth not all of them are fun; one time I was arrested by the Eorzean police department for fishing without a fishing permit and had to answer some moogle trivia, unfortunately I had been slacking on my moogle dailies and couldn't answer correctly so I had to go to jail.the duty finder feature is excellent, as a dragoon player I have to wait around 10 minutes for each dungeon queue to pop so I have plenty of time to make a sandwich, which begs the obvious question of 'how do I have enough time to eat it'? Thankfully as a dragoon player I don't know what the ♥♥♥♥ I am doing and will spend most of the instance dead so I have plenty of time to eat.some people may be turned off by the fact that you have to pay a monthly subscription in order to play this game but I can assure you, thanks to the beneficial effects of the sunk cost fallacy you will spend too much time convincing yourself that it's worth it to even consider unsubbing!all in all a truly excellent game, thank you yoshi p 10/10 i love content AND japan
